item.name: tooltip
item.item: ↑ Use this field if you have good cron knowledge.

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Launches catalog re-index after the import process is finished. Enable to make the products appear at the frontend right after the import.

item.name: config
item.item: Auto generating shipment by track info

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Automatically generates shipment for the order whenever you import tracking codes.

item.name: config
item.item: Auto generating invoice by track info

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Automatically generates invoice for the order whenever you import tracking codes.

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Automatically sends an email notification to the customer whenever you import tracking codes.

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Changes product attribute mapping to support Shopify and MagMi product files.

item.name: config
tooltip
item.item: If enabled, will clear values of ALL optional product attributes, such as ‘size’ and ‘color’.
↑ Empty/deselect values for ALL optional attributes you are importing. Use carefully.

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Grouped products from the imported list, which are already present at the store, will have simple products assigned to them removed. Only simple products from the imported list will be assigned to such grouped.

item.name: config
item.item: Import base image as small and thumbnail

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Import a base image as small and thumbnail if such images are not specified in the import file

item.name: config
tooltip
item.item: Clears images association of imported products if they already exist at the store. Only images from the import list will be assigned.
↑ All existing image allocation will be removed from db (not from directory)

item.name: tooltip
item.item: If ‘Remove All Images’ enabled, also deletes images from the Magento 2 storage folder.

item.name: config
tooltip
item.item: Allows image resize option for products. Requires Imagick for PHP 7 library installed.
↑ Images Will be resized after import.

item.name: config
tooltip
item.item: Clears website association of imported products if they already exist at the store. Only websites from the import list will be assigned.
↑ Removes any old Websites Assigned to Product

item.name: config
tooltip
item.item: Clears categories association of imported products if they already exist at the store. Only categories from the import list will be assigned.
↑ Removes old Categories Assigned to Product

item.name: config
tooltip
item.item: Clears related product association of imported products if they already exist at the store. Only related products from the import list will be assigned.
↑ Old related products will be replaced by new related products from import file

item.name: config
tooltip
item.item: Clears cross-sell products association of imported products if they already exist at the store. Only cross-sell products from the import list will be assigned.
↑ Old crosssell products will be replaced by new crosssell products from import file

item.name: config
tooltip
item.item: Clears up-sell products association of imported products if they already exist at the store. Only up-sell products from the impot list will be assigned.
↑ Old upsell products will be replaced by new upsell products from import file

item.name: config
tooltip
item.item: It will use only mapped fields to import, from the Map Attributes section.
↑ Only mapped fields will be used to import

item.name: config
item.item: Add product QTY to existing value
↑ Adds QTY from the file to current product QTY valueY

item.name: config
tooltip
item.item: Products that already exist at the store, but are not in the import list will be disabled after import.
↑ Disable Products if not in list.

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Caches product by the row hash. If you add new rows inside the import table, only the new rows will be imported.

item.name: config
item.item: ↑ Enable to use product url pattern

item.name: tooltip
item.item: The list of PHP functions is limited and contains two functions rand() and mt_rand().

item.name: tooltip
item.item: If the imported product or category has ‘url_key’ value that already exists, it will be incremented to allow new product or category creation.

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Clears address association of imported customers if they already exist at the store. Only addresses from the import list will be assigned.

item.name: config
item.item: Please specify number of errors to halt import process

item.name: config
item.item: The format of categories column in your CSV is :Root Category%uLevel1%uLevel2

item.name: config
item.item: The format of categories column in your CSV is : Root Category%u1Level1A%u2 Root Category%u1Level1B

item.name: tooltip
item.item: The import position for run into the chain by console import:job:run-chain. Sorting from highest to lowest. If not specified, the job will not run in the chain.

item.name: config
item.item: ↑ Feature to scan and import files from a directory for the fileType selected above and based on source Type.

item.name: tooltip
item.item: ⚠ Can only be used on CLI or CRON.

item.name: config
item.item: Stop if file cannot be imported
↑ With the "All files from folder" option selected, stop the import loop if the file cannot be imported.

item.name: tooltip
item.item: The file will be removed even if error / successful

item.name: tooltip
item.item: If enabled, will look for images inside the selected source according to the path set in the file. If disabled, will look inside Magento 2 root.

item.name: config
item.item: Do you want to remove current mappings?

item.name: tooltip
item.item: All mappings you have set in this import job will be disregarded.

item.name: config
item.item: Associate child reviews to configurable parent product

item.name: config
item.item: Associate child reviews to bundle parent product

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Defines the reference category for starting all category paths in the import file.

item.name: config
item.item: Custom logic for creation of configurable products

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Defines if configurable products should be created from only simple products in the import file.

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Column which should be used as a reference for aggregating simple products for configurables.

item.name: tooltip
item.item: Allows specifying a number of symbols the extension should read considering ‘Configurable Product Condition’.

item.name: config
item.item: Product attributes to copy value(Carefully choose the system attributes otherwise config product will not be created correctly)
↑ Carefully choose the system attributes otherwise config product will not be created correctly
↑ Carefully choose the system attributes otherwise config product will not be created correctly
